titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Allen Forte Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Anne Harrison

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday December 6, 2018 at 01:00

did.abstract: The Allen Forte Collection includes theoretical analyses (published and unpublished); materials related to courses that Forte taught; general theory materials; drafts of articles and lectures; and a small number of photos, personal documents, books and scores.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Allen Forte Papers are comprised of five series: I. Analyses; II. Correspondence; III. Teaching and general theory materials; IV. Manuscript drafts, writings, and lectures; and V. Photos, personal documents, books and scores.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Allen Forte (1926-2014) was the Battell Professor Emeritus of the Theory of Music at Yale University. He was a specialist in 20th-century atonal music, musical analysis using Schenkerian methods, and the American popular ballad. He is the author of over one hundred books and articles, and advised seventy-two Ph.D. dissertations. Allen Forte received his B.A. and M.A. from Columbia University, and taught at Columbia University Teachers College, Manhattan School of Music, and Mannes College of Music before joining the faculty of Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Allen Forte Collection includes theoretical analyses (published and unpublished) of the works of a wide variety of composers; a selection of Forte's correspondence, which includes letters to and from Ernst Oster, Gertrud Schoenberg, and other notable music theorists; materials related to some of the courses Forte taught; general theory materials; drafts of some of Forte's published and unpublished articles and lectures; and a selection of photos, personal documents, books and scores.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers may wish to consult the Allen Forte Electronic Archive, and the Allen and Madeleine Forte Memorial Collection, both housed at the University of North Texas Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 135, the Allen Forte Papers in the Gilmore Music Library at Yale University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Allen and Madeleine Forte.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of analytical notes and graphs, organized by composer. In most cases the analyses are of a single movement or section. Many are detailed, and some that were used for publication have copies of formatted examples. A few are very rudimentary and incomplete. Some composers are represented by a single work; others by 10 or more. Composers with a large number of analyzed works include J.S. Bach, Beethoven, Debussy, Schoenberg, Schubert, Stravinsky, and Webern. A small amount of analytical materials from conferences, with annotations by Forte, are included. In a few instances correspondence about the analysis of a particular work is included.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by composer, and then by opus number or date of composition, if possible. Dates shown after the composer's name or title of the work indicate the date of Forte's analysis, if it is indicated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Analyses of "Three Theatrical Songs" (As Long as It Isn't Love; Penelope's Night Song; Now You See It) and "The Widow's Lament in Springtime". Also includes material and correspondence regarding a talk given at A Symposium in Honor of Milton Babbitt (1998) and article publication, both entitled 'Milton Babbitt's "Three Theatrical Songs" in Perspective".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The correspondence series covers a wide range of topics. Correpondence between Forte and several prominent people in the music world are housed separately. These include Gertrud Schoenberg, Ernst Oster, David Carson Berry, and Robert Sherlaw Johnson. Other correspondence relates to a mixture of institutional, publishing, and personal topics. Dates of these letters range from 1965 to 2007, but are highly concentrated in the 1970's. Included is some correspondence of Madeleine Forte with Olivier Messiaen.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is mainly arranged by date, though correspondence with selected people is separated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Pat Hall and Brenda Dalen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Email correspondence with David Carson Berry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence re Messiaen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains papers related to various courses and class lectures given by Forte. Some syllabi, bibliographies, and exercises and quizes are included. General theory materials, some of which may have been used for teaching, are also included in this series. This collection represents a small selection of Forte's contribution to teaching.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is organized by course or lecture title, where possible.

did.unittitle: Course: Theory and Analysis of Atonal Music
Course: Experimental Tradition in the Music of the 19th Century
Course: Four Twentieth Century Austrian Composers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of analytical graphs by Ernst Oster. Chopin Op. 35/iv; others unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to some of Forte's public lectures and writings, both published and unpublished. The materials include drafts of articles, including examples, and correspondence relating to publication. Materials about several combination lecture/recitals featuring Madeleine Forte on piano are included.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by the title of the article or lecture.

Photos, personal documents, books and scores

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is a collection of personal documents, photos, and autobiographical materials. Various books and scores are included here.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by the type of artifact.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Curriculum Vitae and Bibliography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Pocket scores for various works for which analyses do not exist in this collection; Copies of Schenker, "Five Graphic Music Analyses", Cherney, "Harry Somers" (inscription to Madeliene Hsu (Forte) from Harry Somers, PhD dissertation of Hengzhan Yang (1999, incribed to Allen Forte), Score and correspondence - "The willows are new" by Chou Wen-chung, inscribed to Madeleine Forte, Guide to "Canadian Piano Music", Forte's "The Structure of Atonal Music" in Chinese, with inscription and photo of Forte with the translator, Selected music works by Luo Zhongrong; Scores, articles, dissertation (Wang Zhongyu), and books (with inscriptions) in Chinese.
